definitions.text: condition of heightened watchfulness or preparation for action
examples: bombers were put on alert during the crisis

definitions.text: a warning serves to make you more alert to danger
an automatic signal (usually a sound) warning of danger
warn or arouse to a sense of danger or call to a state of preparedness
examples: We alerted the new neighbors to the high rate of burglaries

definitions.text: engaged in or accustomed to close observation
examples: caught by a couple of alert cops
alert enough to spot the opportunity when it came
constantly alert and vigilant, like a sentinel on duty
a brisk walk in the park
alive to what is going on
awake to the dangers of her situation
was now awake to the reality of his predicament
